Job Description:
- Lead/Develop the OPS team (200+ people): hiring, training/coaching to fit the OPS requirements. Use the L&D center and the GROW model
- Promotion of the Employee Pulse survey, and close monitoring of results. To address findings with solutions. Use the Dolphon Program as a guide
- Optimization of CoL, OT and incentives with the budget and actual revenues/results. Evaluations (probation, annual and promotion)
- Support all departments of HungryApp to work with other involved EFGC departments. Make sure everyone works together smoothly as 1 team
-Leader of the definition and implementation of SOPs for Drivers and Call-Center Agents
- Understand & Analyze in details with data/facts other food aggregators used by EFGC to de-risk the EFGC dependency on other aggregators. Take appropriate actions to address findings 
- Understand the trend of customer's preferences and interests, as well as general digital/technology trend 
- Apply all possible methods and best practices for: (a) The service provided by the drivers to customers (b) The Call-Center Management (inbounds and outbound calls) (c) A professional Messenger (and other live chat box) Management (d) Support to develop partnerships with local corporations 
(2) Optimize the cost of labor based on sales, with smart, smooth working shifts (optimized roster per day and hour)
- Support the Drivers Manager to allocate the right number of drivers per location. Maximize drivers’ performance based on targeted del. dockets 
- Adjust the Call-Center headcounts on the actual volume of call-center calls
(3) Pilot operations excellence management
- Define and implement SOPs for Drivers and Call-Center Agents, including best practices
- Maintain strong relationship with the stores’ teams to apply all HungryApp operating procedures
- Stock Management of drinks purchased by the HungryApp // - Support the interface of the HungryApp with LSNAV system
(4) HR development:
- Lead a team of 200+ members and the Pulse survey – Develop strong relationships
- Coach the team about all the aspects above, using the GROW model and the Dolphin Program
- Define annual objectives and lead quarterly review with each team member
Job Requirement: #NAME?
Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information EFG Cambodia   017 888 349 efgcareer@rmagroup.net #320, Mao Tse Tong Blvd, Sangkat Tek Laak 1, Khan Toul Kok 017 888 349

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information EFG Cambodia   017 888 349 efgcareer@rmagroup.net #320, Mao Tse Tong Blvd, Sangkat Tek Laak 1, Khan Toul Kok 017 888 349

Job Description:
Purposes of the Position

• Manage electrical team in monitoring & controlling power supply to ensure that operation of all Tenants are smoothly operated.
• To counsel technical support, compromise with civil work in order to avoid any effect to all tenants operation and construction and supervise daily operation activities related to technical work in order to provide service to customers regarding to power supply, water supply and waste water treatment process.

Roles and Responsibilities

• Create electrical drawings in AutoCAD to be included in architectural permit package for City submittal/review including power, lighting, and communication.
• Provide engineering and technical support for internal/external construction trades.
• Conceptualize and design energy efficiency programs for implementation across various facilities components such as lighting, motor controls, power systems, etc.
• Confer with engineers, end users, and project controllers to discuss existing or potential engineering projects/products.
• Design electrical instruments, components, and facilities for commercial and industrial applications.
• Direct and coordinate construction, installation, maintenance, documentation, and testing activities to ensure compliance with specifications, codes, and end user requirements.
• Perform detailed calculations to compute and establish construction and installation standards and specifications.
• Inspect completed installations and observe operations to ensure conformance to design
and equipment specifications, as well as safety standards.
• Develop work scopes with project management and end users for material takeoff and job spec.
• Conduct value engineering functions.
• Support estimating and business development.
• Assist in scheduling and coordination of electrical engineering work with project manager.
• Prepare analysis/report for energy savings programs and value engineering.
• Technical problem resolution.
Job Requirement:
Qualifications and Skills Required

• At least qualified and recognized bachelor degree of electrical engineering.
• Minimum 6 years of experience of electrical work or related fields, preferably in Medium voltage power system.
• Ability to design electrical system and qualified knowledge of control system.
• Good self-determination and leadership.
• Qualified ability to use software applications
• Good negotiation and influencing skill
• Good planning and organization skill
• Strong oral and written communication skill
• Ability to work in flexible shift
• Ability to work in team and cross sections and department
• Good writing and speaking in English.

Relationships

Internal: Supervisor of power distribution is required to collaborate with supervisor and staff
in technical section and have good relationship with other staffs of other departments
to ensure smooth and effective operation and provide satisfactory service to customers.
External: Job holder is also required to closely work with concerning contractors, supplier, technical engineers and service provider in PPSEZ.

Job Description: • Legal Manager is required to handle various legal matters after understanding the client's case. • Legal Manager needs to offer advice on managing the tender documents. • Legal Manager needs to review the existing legal cases of the organization and work upon resolving them. • Legal Manager is involved in hiring members for the legal department after assessing their skills and abilities. • Legal Manager is required to train the newly joined staff members on various legal aspects. • Legal Manager needs to provide legal advice to the management. • Legal Manager is required to analyze the risks while signing new business deals. • Legal Manager needs to analyze legal information and do the essential paperwork. • Legal Manager is required to handle litigation management. • Legal Manager is required to review contracts and agreements and see to it that they comply with the legal norms. • Legal Manager is required to deal with external law authorities. • Legal Manager needs to review the legal risks involved in various business deals and share the same with the management.
Job Requirement: • Graduated from Law major. • At least 5 years experience in law. • Technical understanding of the Company.'s business and operations and attention to details. • Excellent interpersonal communication at all levels (verbal and written). • Problem solving and analytical skills. • Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines. • Ability to cope with high levels of responsibility and with confidential matters. • Ability to work well within the team. • A high level of professionalism which is required on the job at all times. • Computer Literacy.

Job Description:
- Relieves Chief Executive Officer of administrative functions in 
  order to increase the time CEO to be available to spend for 
  executive level responsibilities;
- Handles a wide variety of complex and confidential situations 
  and resolves conflicts involving the clerical and
  administrative function of the office;
- Responsible for confidential and time sensitive material;
- Maintain accurate records of senior leadership team and staff 
  meetings, distributing agendas, minutes and other
  relevant documentation as required.
- Organise meetings and take minutes during the management 
  meeting;
- Make preparation for committee meetings;
- Ensure that all manual and computerized records and filing 
  systems relating to all areas within her/his remit are
  maintained as required.
- Maintain the general filing system and file all correspondences;
- Assist in the setting up and maintaining of archive files and 
  historical data.
- Process, input, extract and analyse information from database 
  systems.
- Verify filing and documentation in safety place and store 
  properly in the drives;
- Ensure the website is maintained, up-to-date and meets all 
  current requirements
- Deal with correspondence promptly and as required
- Translate in written and verbal in and from Khmer to English and 
  vice versa;
- Response to public inquiries to meet CEO;
- Ensure that all administrative duties, checks, documentation, 
  reports and returns are completed accurately and submitted 
  within required deadlines.
- Must be able to contact any time a lot to respond for urgent 
  case; and
- Other duties are assigned from CEO if it is necessary and 
  urgent.

job title: Project Director  Local $ 5,000 Up to___Very Urgent
position: Project Director  Local $ 5,000 Up to___Very Urgent
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering, Architecture, 
  Construction Management, or a related field. Master’s 
  degree is preferred
- At least 10 years of experience with real estate companies 
  or with sizable construction organizations
- At least 8 years of senior management experience
- Technical and field expertise
- Familiarity with contemporary construction technologies
- Experience in managing a wide variety of product portfolio 
  from low to high rise buildings and from residential to 
  commercial including hotel complex
- Advanced technical knowledge of design and construction 
  management processes,techniques and methods
- In-depth knowledge of site development and construction 
  techniques, permitting and inspections
- Advanced knowledge of building products, construction 
  details and relevant rules, regulations and quality 
  standards
- Familiarity with construction management software packages
- Project management and risk management
- Ability to analyze and interpret technical reports, 
  materials, etc.
- Ability to develop/analyze budget and cost to keep the 
  Project into fixed parameters
- Demonstrate ability to manage complex construction 
  projects within established time frames and on budget
- Advanced skills in construction safety, contract 
  management, engineering estimating/costing, scheduling, 
  planning and execution
- Strong project management skills with past successes in 
  building high-performing teams and influencing others to 
  drive results
- Ability to handle multiple tasks and coordination of work 
  crews concurrently
- Strong analytical skills
- Strong business, commercial and acumen
- Strong financial control knowledge
- Excellent communication skills
- Strong interpersonal skills
- Ability to think creatively and inventively
- Ability to work under pressure
- Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative 
  environment
- Ability to communicate well in both written and oral English
